bill_title: require the Department of Education to report to the legislative education standing committees prior to implementing a curriculum change.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to require the Department of Education to report to the legislative education standing committees prior to implementing a curriculum change. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 13-1 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Prior to implementing any change in course curriculum or standards, the Department of Education shall provide a report to the education standing committees of the Legislature no later than the final day to introduce individual bills in the Legislature. In the report to the standing committees, the department shall describe all of the changes to curriculum or to the required standards and shall explain why the change is needed. 170 copies were printed on recycled paper by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.098 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

action_log.status_text: First read in Senate and referred to
